column1: # The observer, Mr Teague, is listed as living at 13 St Botolph's Terrace.
# St Botolph's Terrace is on the High Street between Queen Streeet and Shakespeare Street, just north of St Botolph's church.
# This location has been used for the grid reference.
# However, the initial entries in British Rainfall for this site, for 1874, 1875 and 1876, are listed as Lincoln Water Works (Mr Teague was a water engineer.)
# British Rainfall only starts referring to the site as St Botolphs from 1877.
# So it is possible that earlier readings were at Lincoln Water Works (SK968694).
# Mr Teague's 1870 and 1871 readings are duplicated on the Doddington Hall sheet.
